speaker: PERICLES
text:
Yet
               
              cease
               
              your
               
              ire
              ,
               
              you
               
              angry
               
              stars
               
              of
               
              heaven
              !

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Wind
              ,
               
              rain
              ,
               
              and
               
              thunder
              ,
               
              remember
               
              earthly
               
              man

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Is
               
              but
               
              a
               
              substance
               
              that
               
              must
               
              yield
               
              to
               
              you
              ,

speaker: PERICLES
text:
And
               
              I
              ,
               
              as
               
              fits
               
              my
               
              nature
              ,
               
              do
               
              obey
               
              you
              .

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Alas
              ,
               
              the
               
              seas
               
              hath
               
              cast
               
              me
               
              on
               
              the
               
              rocks
              ,

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Washed
               
              me
               
              from
               
              shore
               
              to
               
              shore
              ,
               
              and
               
              left
               
              my
               
              breath

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Nothing
               
              to
               
              think
               
              on
               
              but
               
              ensuing
               
              death
              .

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Let
               
              it
               
              suffice
               
              the
               
              greatness
               
              of
               
              your
               
              powers

speaker: PERICLES
text:
To
               
              have
               
              bereft
               
              a
               
              prince
               
              of
               
              all
               
              his
               
              fortunes
              ;

speaker: PERICLES
text:
And
              ,
               
              having
               
              thrown
               
              him
               
              from
               
              your
               
              wat’ry
               
              grave
              ,

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Here
               
              to
               
              have
               
              death
               
              in
               
              peace
               
              is
               
              all
               
              he’ll
               
              crave
              .

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: What ho, Pilch!

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Ha, come and bring away the nets!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: What, Patchbreech, I say!

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: What say you, master?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Look how thou stirr’st now! Come

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: away, or I’ll fetch thee with a wanion.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Faith, master, I am thinking of the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: poor men that were cast away before us even now.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Alas, poor souls, it grieved my heart

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: to hear what pitiful cries they made to us to help

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: them, when, welladay, we could scarce help

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: ourselves!

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Nay, master, said not I as much

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: when I saw the porpoise how he bounced and tumbled?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: They say they’re half fish, half flesh. A plague

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: on them! They ne’er come but I look to be washed.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Master, I marvel how the fishes live in the sea.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Why, as men do a-land: the great

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: ones eat up the little ones. I can compare our rich

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: misers to nothing so fitly as to a whale: he plays

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: and tumbles, driving the poor fry before him and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: at last devours them all at a mouthful. Such

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: whales have I heard on a’ the land, who never leave

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: gaping till they swallowed the whole parish—

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: church, steeple, bells and all.

speaker: PERICLES
text: A pretty moral.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: But, master, if I had been the sexton,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: I would have been that day in the belfry.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Why, man?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Because he should have swallowed

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: me too. And when I had been in his belly, I would

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: have kept such a jangling of the bells that he should

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: never have left till he cast bells, steeple, church, and

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: parish up again. But if the good King Simonides

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: were of my mind—

speaker: PERICLES
text: Simonides?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: We would purge the land of these

speaker:
THIRD
               
              FISHERMAN
text: drones that rob the bee of her honey.

speaker: PERICLES
text:
How
               
              from
               
              the
               
              finny
               
              subject
               
              of
               
              the
               
              sea

speaker: PERICLES
text:
These
               
              fishers
               
              tell
               
              the
               
              infirmities
               
              of
               
              men
              ,

speaker: PERICLES
text:
And
               
              from
               
              their
               
              wat’ry
               
              empire
               
              recollect

text:
All
               
              that
               
              may
               
              men
               
              approve
               
              or
               
              men
               
              detect
              !
              —

speaker: PERICLES
text:
Peace
               
              be
               
              at
               
              your
               
              labor
              ,
               
              honest
               
              fishermen
              .

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Honest good fellow, what’s that? If

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: it be a day fits you, search out of the calendar, and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: nobody look after it!

speaker: PERICLES
text:
May
               
              see
               
              the
               
              sea
               
              hath
               
              cast
               
              upon
               
              your
               
              coast
              —

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: What a drunken knave was the sea

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: to cast thee in our way!

speaker: PERICLES
text:
A
               
              man
               
              whom
               
              both
               
              the
               
              waters
               
              and
               
              the
               
              wind

speaker: PERICLES
text:
In
               
              that
               
              vast
               
              tennis
               
              court
               
              hath
               
              made
               
              the
               
              ball

speaker: PERICLES
text:
For
               
              them
               
              to
               
              play
               
              upon
               
              entreats
               
              you
               
              pity
               
              him
              .

speaker: PERICLES
text:
He
               
              asks
               
              of
               
              you
               
              that
               
              never
               
              used
               
              to
               
              beg
              .

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: No, friend, cannot you beg? Here’s

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: them in our country of Greece gets more with begging

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: than we can do with working.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Canst thou catch any

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: fishes, then?

speaker: PERICLES
text: I never practiced it.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Nay, then, thou wilt starve sure,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: for here’s nothing to be got nowadays unless thou

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: canst fish for ’t.

text:
What
               
              I
               
              have
               
              been
               
              I
               
              have
               
              forgot
               
              to
               
              know
              ,

text:
But
               
              what
               
              I
               
              am
               
              want

              on
              :

A
               
              man

              up
               
              with
               
              cold

Which

FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Die, quotha? Now gods forbid ’t, an I

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: have a gown. Here, come, put it on; keep thee

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text:
warm.
                 
                Pericles
                 
                puts
                 
                on
                 
                the
                 
                garment
                .
               Now, afore

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: me, a handsome fellow! Come, thou shalt go home,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: and we’ll have flesh for holidays, fish for fasting

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: days, and, moreo’er, puddings and flapjacks, and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: thou shalt be welcome.

speaker: PERICLES
text: I thank you, sir.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Hark you, my friend. You said you

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: could not beg?

speaker: PERICLES
text: I did but crave.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: But crave? Then I’ll turn craver

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: too, and so I shall ’scape whipping.

speaker: PERICLES
text: Why, are your beggars whipped, then?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: O, not all, my friend, not all; for if

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: all your beggars were whipped, I would wish no

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: better office than to be beadle.—But, master, I’ll go

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: draw up the net.

speaker: PERICLES
text:
How
               
              well
               
              this
               
              honest
               
              mirth
               
              becomes
               
              their
               
              labor
              !

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Hark you, sir, do you know where

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: you are?

speaker: PERICLES
text: Not well.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Why, I’ll tell you. This is called Pentapolis,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: and our king the good Simonides.

speaker: PERICLES
text: “The good Simonides” do you call him?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Ay, sir, and he deserves so to be called

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: for his peaceable reign and good government.

speaker: PERICLES
text: He is a happy king, since he gains from his

speaker: PERICLES
text: subjects the name of “good” by his government.

speaker: PERICLES
text: How far is his court distant from this shore?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Marry, sir, half a day’s journey. And

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: I’ll tell you, he hath a fair daughter, and tomorrow

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: is her birthday; and there are princes and knights

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: come from all parts of the world to joust and tourney

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: for her love.

speaker: PERICLES
text: Were my fortunes equal to my desires, I

speaker: PERICLES
text: could wish to make one there.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: O, sir, things must be as they may;

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: and what a man cannot get he may lawfully deal

speaker:
FIRST
               
              FISHERMAN
text: for his wife’s soul.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: Help, master, help! Here’s a fish

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: hangs in the net like a poor man’s right in the law:

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: ’twill hardly come out. Ha! Bots on ’t, ’tis come at

speaker:
SECOND
               
              FISHERMAN
text: last, and ’tis turned to a rusty armor.

text:
An
               
              armor
              ,
               
              friends
              ?
               
              I

              you

              me

              it
              .

Thanks
              ,

              after

              ;

“

              ”

              —

The

              —

              .

It

Till
               
              the

Took

I

Since
               
              I

              my

To
